name: La Mer Hotel and Dewey House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed our first night in Key West at the Dewey House. To be honest, we waited too long to book the B&B where I had previously stayed. The Dewey House was the only opening on the island for our first night, and I was extremely excited as I'd heard wonders. It did not disappoint. I can honestly say that it's the best place either of us has stayed in the entire country. The Dewey House has a traditional elegance that somehow seamlessly blends into coastal chic. We stayed on the second floor, by the stairs, with an enclosed balcony facing the street. It was flawlessly quiet, and the bathroom was beautiful and spotlessly clean. I would have much rather spent half the time in Key West that we did so that we could've afforded an entire stay at this property. Seriously, it's that good. The concierge called us a cab to the Blue Angels Air Show. We ate the best breakfast of our trip (espresso, English muffins, fruit, cheese, and yogurt) out on the beautiful beach-front patio. The location is on the absolute end of Duval Street. At first, we saw that as a negative, but if we did the trip over again, I promise you we would've spent entire days reading on the beach, lounging on our balcony, and enjoying food and drink at the Southernmost Beach Cafe next door. . . with brief trips out to the marina and dinner. It's a splendid property that offers the luxury that's too often missing from a Key West vacation. Skip the hotel chains and other B&Bs. They can't compare. This was my husband's first trip to KW, and I had wanted to just book where I'd stayed before. I hugely regret that decision! I sincerely hope you choose to stay at the Dewey House for your entire trip!
reviews.title: Amazing March 2013 stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights in the Ocean front suite, room 404, which was on the ground floor. The view was spectacular. The LaMer and Dewey houses are charming, the grounds are tropical and private and very well maintained. The suite was not overly large, but well appointed and cozy. The bathroom was large with a large shower, but no jacuzzi tub, which was my only disappointment. We really enjoyed our short stay, and would definitely plan to stay there again in the future!
reviews.title: La Mer Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the La Mer and Dewey House May 20th- 24th. This was our third trip to Key West but our first time staying at La Mer and Dewey House. We will never stay anywhere else. This place is a gem! This hotel is on the Gulf side of the island a block or so away from Duvall street ( the main street of Key West). You are walking distance to everything. When we first arrived at the hotel, we were met by Randell a wonderful gentleman who took us around the hotel grounds and gave us helpful information about activities going on at the hotel during our stay like Scuba class,wine and beer class, yoga etc. Boomer runs a lot of these activities and he is a great guy who will make sure you are never bored while staying at La Mer. Our room was wonderful with a spectacular view of the beach! We had a balcony that faced the beach. we would sit out there in the evening having a glass of wine enjoying the wonderful weather and watching the sun set. We could not of asked for anything better! This hotel has three pools one had live music every day with many activities throughout the day. The other pool was the tranquility pool for those who just enjoyed the quite and wanted to relax and read. The 3rd pool was the Pineapple pool. Every morning breakfast was served while you sat at cafe tables that overlooked the beautiful beach with crystal clear blue water. If that wasn't enough to wet your appetite,they spoiled you with delicious food; fresh waffles, quiche, every kind of fruit, Muffin and breads, yogurt, coffee, and cappuccino. Relaxation with a top notch view! This is a wonderful hotel to stay at in Key West and in our opinion the very best place to stay! We look forward to coming back and staying at this wonderful gem!
reviews.title: The three R's of Key West, Romantic, Relaxing & Remarkable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights in the Dewey House and couldn't have been more pleased. While our 2nd floor room was on the small side (garden view), it still had everything we needed...refrigerator, safe, coffee maker, roomy bath and balcony with an ocean view. The daily breakfast and afternoon tea was great and afforded several delicious options. The staff at the Southernmost hotel group was accommodating and friendly. In fact, shortly after our return home, we received a note from the Dewey House staff, Sam, Randall, Darleen and Jenny, thanking us for our stay. What a nice touch! If we're ever in Key West again, we would definitely return to the Dewey House.
reviews.title: THE place to stay in Key West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You have to stay here if you are going to Key West without children. My wife and I stayed at the La Mer hotel, which is just like the Dewey House only with direct access from the covered porch. Our room was quiet and our bed was very comfortable. The breakfast and tea time were wonderful. We didn't even need to spend money on lunch because of the many food options available at both. The innkeepers made us feel like we were at a friend's house. The location can't be beat. All beaches had free cold water available and each day we were given two bottles of water. In addition they gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne. Since it was my 40th birthday, they gave us two coupons for a free drink from the bar. It was a perfect setting, quiet and relaxing within short walking distance of Duval Street without the noise.
reviews.title: The only place to stay in Key West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I swpen 4 nights at the Dewey House in June for our first trip to Key West celebrating our 36th Anniversary.. The moment we arrived it was as if we were the only guests they had. We were treated like no other B&B has ever treated us. I will rave and I mean absolutely rave about Sam. Sam was the epitome of guest relations. She showed us our room, she gave us ideas of things to do, offered and gave us a champagne cocktail on our arrival. During our 4 days, Sam was by far the most pleasant and outstanding staff I have ever encountered. The rest of the staff were fantastic also but she just made you feel welcomed and appreciated. Southernmost, take note, Sam is one of your most valuable assets. Our room was incredible, housekeeping was above and beyond what is considered normal. The pools, the beach, the bars and the bartenders were all top shelf. I would recommend the Dewey and certainly not even think of staying anywhere else in Key wet.
reviews.title: Beyond Expectations!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We loved our stay at la mer hotel at southernmost hotel, great location and pool. Staff members like samantha and jen made our stay so comfortable and nice. We wouldn't think of staying anywhere else. Only drawback was the restaurant. It was not up to par with the rest of the hotel....Tony and Lorna NJ
reviews.title: wonderful staff

reviews.title: Property and Staff are the BEST

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good beach side resturant (with own beach which can be shared with locals) and amazing views.
reviews.title: Loved La Mer!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a room last minute, making same day reservations for 2 couples traveling in after other accommodations fell through. The front desk was great helping us select a room and securing the reservation. We selected a room at Le Mer, the bed and breakfast hotel attached to the Southernmost Hotel. When we arrived, we were welcomed like their best guests - the front desk was well staffed so we were quickly checked in. After checking in, we were personally shown to our rooms by a staff member that for our brief stay treated us like old friends. The room provided a champagne cocktail at arrival, access to afternoon snacks which included fresh tropical fruits, desert, coffee and tea. Our room was immaculate, stocked with water bottles, plenty of plush towels and beautifully appointed. The property includes access to a great beach, 3 pools, several bars and no shortage of private, intimate shady places to rest. This hotel is a great escape from Key Wests craziness but close enough to shopping and bars that you can walk everywhere. Definitely lives up to its high rating - not to be missed if you want your stay in Key West to be memorable, stress free and respite from the crowds and noise.
reviews.title: Great Location & Amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been vacationing in Key West for many years since we got married here 11 years ago and have stayed at many B&B's and loved them all but this past May we fell in LOVE LOVE LOVE with the La Mer Hotel and Dewey House. From the moment we arrived we were treated exceptionally, our room was gorgeous and so clean and well appointed. Both the La Mer and Dewey were just beautiful we truly found our happy place, we had that B&B feel that we have grown to love while visiting Key West with all the amenities of staying in a luxuary Hotel with access to all that the Southernmost on the Beach Hotel and the Southernmost Hotel had to offer, pools, bars and activities.
reviews.title: Fell in LOVE with a turn in our vacation...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our 3rd day there unfortunatly I had an accident and messed my leg up pretty badly and our Anniversary Vacation took a sudden turn. What could have been a total disaster turn out to be one of the best relaxing vacations we have ever been on and we have The Southernmost Hotel Collection to thank for that, we didnt get to do all the things we had planned on doing but it really gave us a chance to slow down in this perfect paradise, despite my injury.
reviews.title: We wouldn't stay anywhere else after La Mer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: The Inn Keepers and Staff at the LaMer Hotel and Dewey House and at the Hotels, the staff at the Southermost Beach Cafe' and Michael and Fletcher who ran the beach were AWESOME!!!! They were all so helpful to me and my husband from dealing with changing rooms from 2nd floor to a 1st floor so I didnt have to climb the stairs, to helping us with seeing a Doctor, getting us a wheel chair, to bringing us take-out from the Cafe, to saving the same 2 lounge chairs and umbrella on the beach for us for the remainder of our vacation and continuing to check on us to see if there was anything we needed.
reviews.title: No need to look any further. Stay here. Trust me!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was definetly a different vacation for us but one we will never forget. We are so grateful for everyone who helped us during those last 3 days of our vacation and we won't just be back next year this will be the only place we stay at from now on when we visit Key West.
reviews.title: Beyond Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being a VERY picky person, I can honestly say that this property met and exceeded my expectations. Sam and the front desk staff were very nice! Our room was upgraded, and it was beautiful...nice size...luxurious...the pools on the property are fantastic! Attn to detail and service was great! Will def stay here again!
reviews.title: JUST WHAT THE DR. ORDERED...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first trip to Key West and I felt so blessed to find this place for our first trip and our anniversary. Room was top shelf and we felt like royalty. We had a patio overlooking the garden and a fountain. The breakfast included in the room price was magnificent. Fresh fruit and a variety of breads and Danish and the coffee was excellent. Some mornings we were offered Mimosa's as well. Fantastic. Great location to get around as well. We rented bikes and spent a morning exploring. My husband and I will be back. Fell in love with the place. Best vacation ever!!!
reviews.title: 30th Anniversary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visited in June and had a fantastic time, despite rain everyday. The accommodations in this B&B afiliated with the Southermost Hotel were wonderful. It is at a perfect location - at the quiet end of Duval, but close enough to walk to all the hot spots. The breakfast included was exceptional. The service in ALL areas of the property was second to none. I would like to especially thank Tracey, who made my original arrangements and answered all my questions prior to my visit; to Don at the Cafe, who served us on two of the evenings we had dinner there and added to our culinary enjoyment; lastly, to Sam (Messier) who greeted us, chatted with us at breakfast and elsewhere on the property and provided great info for our stay. Every staff member we encountered was terrific. Had such an amazing time, we have already booked our next trip there.
reviews.title: Key West Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Key West. We drove from Miami and checked in at the Le Mer. Everyone at the front desk was very helpful, friendly and fun. Their suggestions for dining were right on the mark. Our room was spacious and very quiet. The breakfast was scrumptious. Great location to see everything in Key West. We should have stayed longer and plan to visit again.
reviews.title: Ahhhh, best vacation ever!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Just returned from a 4 night stay in the Dewey House in the Oceanfront room. Fantastic stay! From the greeting at the front desk by friendly Sam, to the morning breakfasts & afternoon tea w/ wonderful Randall to the cool bartenders at the Cafe; the staff here clearly love their jobs & make you feel welcome. The room was very clean & smelled so fresh; serviced twice daily by excellent housekeepers. The room I had was large with all the usual amenities plus a great whirlpool tub which was great after all the walking around Key West. The beautiful view was of the little South beach which is tiny but grew on me. They have 3 pools to choose from but I loved the adult tranquility pool which had upgraded furnishings. Add in plenty of free parking & free wifi, plenty of beach towels, activities & this is the only place to stay. I loved my balcony, the hammocks & just reading by the pool. You will not find any better in Key West for the price for sure. PS the Butterfly Conservatory is 1 block away; must go there & for sunsets go to Zachary State park instead of Mallory Square. Awesome; can't wait to go back
reviews.title: 5 star stay at Dewey House
